website_summaries.verdict: An excellent choice if you are looking for a grooming glove specifically for de-shedding.
pros: Effectively de-sheds dogs, cats, and horses
Customers rave over how much their animals enjoy being petted with this gentle glove
Fits most hands well with the adjustable wrist bands
cons: Fur is difficult to peel off glove
Loose fur can fly out when removing hair from glove

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my living, breathing cottonball
customer_reviews.text: have a rag doll who is 99% fur 1% cat. this glove is perfect for daily shedding. It won't get the mats but should help prevent them. he loves when I use it.
customer_reviews.author: menacing pickle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product. Wish I had these from the beginning. Reduced the amount of time to groom my big dogs significantly.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Wish I had these from the beginning. Reduced the amount of time to groom my big dogs significantly. What I do now: Use this product first for about 10 minutes, follow with a regular brush for 5 minutes, then Furminator until I'm satisfied with how much I'm getting off. I used to spend up to 1 hour once a week on my long haired shepherd. Reduced that to about 30 minutes by using the Pet Grooming Gloves first!!! Very satisfied. Make sure you use them until the gloves look like they have miniature dog-hair rugs on them then just peel them off!
customer_reviews.author: Robert T Barker

customer_reviews.title: This Glove Works!!!!!!~!!
customer_reviews.text: Eureka....it works. My 14 year old 15 pound cat, Audi, has displaced aggression and will not allow me to brush him. He's a Ragdoll mix and is on Prozac.......the glove does work as advertised and the hair really accumulates on the glove.......leading, we hope, to less hairballs!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought to use on my cat. I had read another review that said her cat was afraid of it so I left the glove laying on the bed while kitty snoozed. Later she sniffed it and played with it a little. That evening I started petting her with it and she couldn't get enough of it. The hair came off easily. Nice product, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: FLGal2

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: We have three kittens that we adopted and two have white hair. I wear the color black a lot so as you can imagine I have a lot of white hairs on my clothes. This glove has helped cut down on the hair floating around the house and the kittens like to be brushed.
customer_reviews.author: John DeRoule

customer_reviews.title: Works great ,as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This works very well, better than a regular brush. Definitely gets most of the shedding hair off your pet and the hair that's about to shed .The only downside is the glove is a lot more work compared to a brush plus it seems like a neverending process you could probably brush your pet with this for an hour and still pick up hair at least on my dog (she doesn't have long hair but does her fair share of shedding, nothing near my last dog a Golden retriever. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J

customer_reviews.title: Siberian Husky
customer_reviews.text: I have a Siberian Husky & live in Texas, nuff said... lol So when I say we have a little hair problem, I'm serious, dead serious. My husky doesn't like being brushed, she always fights me sigh This "Grooming Glove" has transformed her into a dog that now looks forward to being brushed, er I mean I'm just petting her >wink< The nubs on the brush are whats the selling point to my dog, she thinks I'm really just massaging her. If I could only recycle this fluff! It just rolls off her & onto the glove & then just peels off & into the trash. Love it. I'm thinking about getting another so I can do two handed "pets".
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline lenox

customer_reviews.title: Awful Quality - 1 day of use
customer_reviews.text: Terrible Quality. They broke the first day of use. See Photo.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Horande

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money not the effort
customer_reviews.text: The product doesn’t work as promised. The video leads you to believe that it’s easy peasey...wrong. The hair does NOT stick to the gloves as shown in the video. It basically grabbed nothing. When using it in furniture, also as described in the overview, it does NOT grab the hair. You have to put muscle into it and work it into a pile, then pick up. I can do that with my hand - no glove.
customer_reviews.author: The Book Nook

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend these gloves. They are perfect for grooming your cat or dog. My babies prefer these to being brushed. The gloves also work on removing hair from my sofa, blankets and clothing. I wish they fit my hand more snug like regular gloves but that doesn't interfere with the grooming.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective for short hair cat
customer_reviews.text: This glove was pretty easy to use, but I didn't find it effective at all for reducing shedding. After lots of brushing with this glove, there's minimal hair on the glove, and still lots of loose hair on my cat. I think the rubber nubs are just too far apart to really grab all the loose hairs. MIght be more effective for a longer hair cat - the wide-spaced nubs might catch longer hair more easily. Switched to a more standard de-shedding brush with metal teeth and noticed the difference immediately - after only a few minutes of use, I'd already collected a huge ball of loose hair from her undercoat!
customer_reviews.author: Alaina T

customer_reviews.title: Pet Lovers MUST Have
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 long haired cats and they always like to be petted but not always brushed. This glove was loved by both cats, within 10 seconds of using it. I can even use it on their tail and the under body area. The BEST part is that the hair "peels" right off. I bought more for gifts. Great product! and it's made so I can use it with both my hands. Velcro around wrist is a nice idea!
customer_reviews.author: topslisa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Do The Job
customer_reviews.text: I read all the glowing reviews so I was pretty excited for mine to arrive. Our Golden Lab has course hair and sheds everywhere! The first problem was the glove was way too large for my hand and it slipped a lot. It couldn’t tighten either. The glove didn’t grab any real amount of hair off of my dog, just a few strands. I get more hair off the dog myself, by simply petting it. I tried it on our cat next. She’s another shedder. Same thing there, the glove didn’t grab any real amount of her hair. Not a complete waste of money, but it definitely isn’t what all the hype is about. You’re better off combing your pet.
customer_reviews.author: Dalia2018

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite grooming tool!  Cat LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: Pros : My cat loves her "petting" time. I was able to collect about a ping pong sized ball of fur from her. The mitts are comfortable to wear and the velcro around the wrist seems sturdy. Cons : The fur does not come off in one sheet and is a bit difficult to get it completely clean after use. I did not find much success with it removing fur from upholstered furniture. SO happy I made this purchase. My cat loves it and I love that there will be mush less fur to laying around to deal with. Highly recommended and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dogs and cat love this. I could brush them all day long ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs and cat love this. I could brush them all day long and they would be happy. The glove does not hold the hair from my dogs, they are both rat terriers and have short hair. When I brush them I still get covered in hair and so does the floor. It does remove the hair and debris great It works very well for the cat which has medium length.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a winner,
customer_reviews.text: Actually neither my husbands' or my opinion of this product matters in the least. The critical review comes from Thomas our very discriminating cat. He approves 100% of the glove. He dislikes all the other grooming tools we have purchased in an attempt to help him maintain his gorgeousness. I am surprised with even a gentle touch, hair is removed without pulling or entangling. Thank you for making this product available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this. She looks forward for her daily grooming!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking quite awhile for a brush to help with my 16lbs rat terrier's excess shedding. I've tried every brush available to help with her really bad shedding problem. The brushes I had were recommended by the veterinarians I found these brushes would hurt her no matter how gentle I am. After all these brushes had wired tips. I tried to cancel this order because I thought it would take too long, but it was already shipped. I just love it!! She does too!! She looks forward to these gentle plastic tip bristles that REALLY removes her excess hair. I feel kind of guilty I didn't purchase this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: EMCnSR

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: these gloves are awesome!! i've just used them with my cat who has a hairball problem and doesn't like brushes, and i wasn't prepared for how much hair came out; i'm sure i could brush for another hour and it would keep coming, i feel awful he's just been gobbling all this hair up when grooming himself. he loved being brushed with it so much, and cleanup is relatively easy, there wasn't as much hair flying around and if it got on my blanket i just used the glove to sweep it all together and clean it right up. i truly am impressed by such a simple item and fully recommend it to anyone with a heavy shedder!
customer_reviews.author: shlee

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work at all for Maine coon, I’ve tried a lot of shedding tools and this is by far the worst.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old Maine coon who has a ridiculous amount of fur. She sheds everywhere and my husband is always less than thrilled about it so I figured we’d give this a try to maybe get some of that loose fur off. It did next to NOTHING. The same little amount of fur that may come off when she’s pet with our bare hands may have come off. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: she really enjoyed her first experience with the Pet Grooming Glove (no ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat should be the one to write this review and I can tell you, she really enjoyed her first experience with the Pet Grooming Glove (no learning curve). She was always coming back towards the glove to get more "massage". The glove really worked to remove dead hair. As mentioned , the more hair on the glove, the easiest it is to peel it away. After the "massage", her fur was shinier and softer. Quite satisfied. My first "customer" is a medium/long hair female cat (11 year old). I have not yet tried the glove on my short hair cat.
customer_reviews.author: Bluething,

customer_reviews.title: Works well for shedding, but my cats hate it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this originally to help with shedding. While it's effective at removing loose hairs, the cats both hate it, so it ended up being a dog only thing. It's not as good at handling long dog fur but still better than nothing. The only thing is that you have to peel the hair out of it with your fingers and sometimes the hair does not seem to want to come off, making this annoying to clean. It's also way too big for my hands and makes me feel like I'm Goofy or Mickey Mouse or something when attempting to wear it. I don't think I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Malon

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy it again
customer_reviews.text: It does what its supposed to do which is help brush your cat or dog (or whatever else has fur). However, the hair sticks to the gloves like glue. I have to wipe my gloves on the concrete to get the fur off of it and my cat has so much fur that I have to do this every few minutes. I like the concept, but need better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Carter

customer_reviews.title: Gets the hair off faster than a regular brush and my cat likes it.
customer_reviews.text: I like this grooming glove. It picks up hair on my high-shedding short hair (who has some pretty long hairs in places) faster than a grooming brush seems to. Although I feel like the regular brush goes deeper than the softer rubber spikes on this glove, the combination of the two is ideal - this is great for those times when the cat gets snippy about the brush and thinks when I wear this I’m just petting him. Regarding some comments about getting the hair off the glove, it peels off best, in one piece, when there is more allowed to accumulate.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I have a cat that sheds like crazy! Used this glove on her and combed off so much loose hair, I could make another cat! And all the while, she loved it, purring like crazy. I chose this one specifically because it has individual fingers as opposed to the other mitten-like style. I feel this style is more comfortable and less-intimidating for the kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Porsche

customer_reviews.title: Our greyhound loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our greyhound loves this! We can't use a furminator on him because his skin is so thin (and because he doesn't have an undercoat like our lab, it wouldn't be as effective). This is gentle, effective, and easy to use. I do wish the hair was a bit easier to peel off (it only peels off easily if I don't try to get it off after every grooming session), once there's a full "layer"), but that's just a minor annoyance. Overall, this is an easy and cost-effective way to groom a pet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Maclauchlan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what kind of animal they used to get the hair to peel like that off of these gloves but it certainly wasn’t dogs or cats like mine. I have a beagle and basset/beagle mix and a cat. Yes, some hair does come off, but not anymore than I can remove with my own hand or out brush. And yes, the animals “like” it but they like any rub or brush down whether it’s with these rip off gloves or with my own hands. The hair does not just peel off. I have to make sure to use the gloves outside then clap my hands together in order to remove the harbor from the gloves. Waste of money...
customer_reviews.author: jennifer brown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent brushing action, cat LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work much better than I expected. My can LOVES to be brushed with this. It almost seems that it's impregnated with catnip although my cat doesn't seem to be very enamored with catnip. And every time I brush her this is able to remove some additional loose hair/fur. Her coat is shinier, smoother, and softer after brushing her a couple times. I very strongly recommend these gloves. A great way to keep your pet's coat in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: William R Midden

customer_reviews.title: Two jobs in one---love on your pet, reduce the hair
customer_reviews.text: I've very happy with the quality of the glove and it works well. I have a shorthair, though, and the hair doesn't just "peel off" the way the video shows because she doesn't produce enough to pack it down between the tines/teeth things. It does wipe off with a rag or paper towel, though, so I'm happy----I would imagine the vacuum would work well, but I haven't used it again since I thought of that!! I'm thrilled to be grabbing some of the hair!!
customer_reviews.author: Ginny1inNC

customer_reviews.title: Worth a shot
customer_reviews.text: I have a beagle. Beagles shed but Not Heavily - short hair dogs. But they still need grooming. This tool helps. I get a fair amount of hair out while I am petting my dog. Because at least for my dog, she thinks she is getting love the moment I start. She doesn’t move. So this is a win win situation. I have it 4 stars because my metal hairbrush gets out more hair, but my dog Doesn’t like that one AT ALL.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie C. Milian

customer_reviews.title: Ugh NO!
customer_reviews.text: I used it one time. My cat hated it. Her hair loved it so much, it stuck to it with the worst static cling. I ended up vacuuming the dang thing and donating the gloves to Goodwill. I would've returned them but it was past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine S.

customer_reviews.title: Not for curly dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I have a poodle. This works with other than a poodle. I can see where these gloves help people with different dogs. This is not a bad review because it didn't work on a poodle that had no grooming for 4 months, thanks to coronovirus. This is absolutely a wonder brush for other dogs, not poodles. I would definitely recommend these gloves with another dog, does not work on a poodle, but is a great tool otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Lirette

customer_reviews.title: I am very glad I ordered this product
customer_reviews.text: A four star only because as I brushed my old girl, who is hairiest old shelter adoptive dog I have ever had, the glove caught maybe 90% of the hair, 10% floated away, so you should do the brushing messaging outside. That said, wow, like 90% less hair on my floor. I will use this daily. I am babysitting another dog right now, and I swear to god, the two of the them line up to be messaged and de-haired. I can't figure out how this glove really captures and holds the hair, but then, that doesn't matter. It just does.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has a major shedding problem and I have tried for quite some time to deal with it using various brushes. While the brushes work to remove the downy fur, they don’t work well with the upper coat. However this glove works wonderfully and collects both! The cat loves being pet with it and rolls around in ecstasy while being stroked. It has tremendously reduced the shedding problem and both me and my cat are very happy!
customer_reviews.author: randible

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price.
customer_reviews.text: Update: After two months of daily use brushing my Lab this glove has held up amazingly. Works great, hair is removed easily and all the tips are still intact. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Super Mario

customer_reviews.title: They love it. Fur comes right off
customer_reviews.text: We love this for brushing. We have a large dog who is afraid of brushes. He thinks we are just petting him. Our cat loves it! Grooms them wonderfully. The only down side isnforna smaller hand like mine, it turns and then sometimes just brushing with the cloth. Wish the rubber nubs covered more of the hand and fingers for smaller female hands. Other than that, this is perfect and amazing my animals beg for it
customer_reviews.author: Lyncarpenter

customer_reviews.title: Good quality glove
customer_reviews.text: Product seems well made & works very well on one of my cats. She loves being petted with it, purring up a storm. It gets lots of loose fur off of her! And it is pretty easy to pull the fur off the glove when enough has accumulated to peel off in a big piece. My other cat, however, doesn't like being petted or rubbed with it. He meows funny and pulls away if we try to use it on him. I finally just.gave up. So it just depends on your cat if this will be a good product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: This product works great!!! Feels good for the kitty, grabs up SO MUCH hair, easy to take on and off. Kitty feels like he's being petted and not brushed so he doesn't need to be convinced to let us use the gloves. Makes a huge difference for how much hair we find around the house, on our clothes, in our mouths, in our food... everywhere! For cleaning, if there is a lot of hair in the brushes, it clings to itself and is easy to "peel" off. It is hard to get the stray hairs from in between the bristles, but I just use the vacuum to suck them out and that does the trick. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: T.B.

customer_reviews.title: A low cost haircut for tabby.
customer_reviews.text: My long haired cat has hair that reminds me of cotton candy, fine, long, and sticky. Using a brush or comb does not contain the flyaway hair that finds its way to my nose, and my cat is not fond of the brushing and combing she needs everyday. This glove makes us both happy. She will voluntarily roll onto her back to have her undercarriage groomed and I can get to places around her legs a comb or brush was not long tolerated. And, no cat hair escapes the glove to make its way to my eyes or nose, my nose has enough hair already.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri J.

customer_reviews.title: My skittish cat LOVES these gloves!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried every type of cat brush I could find. My cat attempted to murder me and didn’t get brushed. I tried other types of gloves and had the same result. I didn’t really expect these to work either, but it was just time to try again. To my extreme surprise and amazement, THIS GLOVES WORKS! It cleans her fur, and more importantly, she LOVES it!!! Thank you SO much for making these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Janie D.

customer_reviews.title: These Were a Waste
customer_reviews.text: Out of our five cats, not one likes the gloves. We thought it would take time for the cats to get used to them, but not one cat will sit still for a brushing with these things. Part of the problem may be that no matter whose hand is in them, they're awkward and want to come off or slip around on the hand. They sit next to the little comb the cats love.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Buy
customer_reviews.text: They are very large in size and my hand slid around inside even after making the Velcro as tight as possible. The pet hair does NOT NOT NOT stick. I tried this on my German Shepard and on my Jack Russell and every stroke the hair just flying all over the place. It did not seem to bring more hair that regular petting. I thing the metal undercoat brush works soo much better on my G.S. And my J.R. Had and obsession with his hairbrush. I have in my car to send back.
customer_reviews.author: Maria S.

customer_reviews.title: They work, and my dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit of getting used to, but this does an excellent job of brushing my wire-furred dog’s fur. Plus, whenever he sees the gloves he gets excited for a brushing/rub down! That doesn’t happen with his other brushes. Once the gloves have collected enough fur, just peel it off. I do have difficulty getting every last fur off the gloves, so have a spare box or container to store them in so you don’t get fur everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa Parmley

customer_reviews.title: It's a glove
customer_reviews.text: This glove gets fur off. But I wouldn't say it's the most amazing thing. I have a mixed breed dog; short hair (Bernese mountain dog and Shephard mix.) I've used it on a long hair Jack Russell and it didn't do a great job on her coat. I can say though, my dog likes it better than brushing because he feels like he's getting attention and petting.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Turney

customer_reviews.title: cat DOESN'T love
customer_reviews.text: this is ok... it definitely gets some fur out but not a ton and by the time i start getting some, my cat is TICKED! I think it's worth a shot for long-haired cats or even-tempered cats. my fiesty short hair is another story. if i'm going to hold him down and torture him for a minute, i'd rather use a comb that gets more stray fur quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Ways Newman

customer_reviews.title: Calmness
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely love these gloves. I own a furminator too but my one cat gets very stressed out when I use it on him more than 2 minutes, he'll hiss and growl after that. Now that I have these all 3 of my cats just lay there and purr. I could probably "brush" them for hours and they wouldn't care. I will continue to use the furminator but only at the very beginning of shedding season and then will automatically switch over to these for everyday maintenance of their fur. I would highly recommend these gloves to all pet owners!!! The interaction with your pet is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK, DOESNT GRAB HAIR
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt work because it barely grabs any hair. I have a persian fluffy cat with LOTS of hair so this product should of worked. I had to brush the poor guy 30x to get SOME hair. its a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Skye

customer_reviews.title: Great way to brush out a greyhound
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar product 25 years ago - all rubber. It worked the same way - but it held the hair tightly to be pulled off in a single sheet. So far I have not been able to do that with this one. It still gets the hair - just can't get the hair off in that neat sheet! Dogs with very short hair need this brush!!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: right and left handed fur gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats that loved to be brushed, but only had one old hand glove. They are brother and sister and fight over who gets brushed first, so when I saw the gloves, right and left handed, I bought the pair. My cats love them and I can brush both of them at the same time...no more bickering. The price was right also. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Janis

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well for my cat
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my short-haired cat. It does collect fur, but using a cheap comb works much better. A lot of fur with fly around when using this. A lot of it will stick to the cloth parts of the glove too. It's easy to pull the accumulated fur off the fingers but not so easy on the palms. Might work better for long-haired cats?
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dobosz

customer_reviews.title: This product will help manage a less hair environment for you and your fur baby.
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased as a gift for a family member. It arrived as promised. The glove fits comfortably and is easy to manage. It definitely makes brushing the cat easier for the user and the receiver. Hair is easy to remove from the glove. This product performs as described. Pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KY Celt

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy way to groom my cats...my chihuahuas not so much. Worked Amazing on removing excess fur from my cat's which are both long and short haired. Left a very thick layer of fur on the glove after using it on them. They also enjoyed it! Didn't take much off my short hair chihuahuas though. Was hoping it would have since one sheds like crazy year round. All in all, great product and worth the money spent
customer_reviews.author: alina stewart

customer_reviews.title: Works great, some fur released into the air
customer_reviews.text: It was amazing the amount of hair that came off of my two short haired cats. The one loved it immediately, the other cat needed a little convincing but she likes it now. The hair doesn’t all stick to the glove, a lot gets in to the air, so I groom them on the porch. So for that reason and also, the mesh of the glove gets hair stuck to it and doesn’t come out so the glove it’s a mess with fur that won’t come out, for those reasons I gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Shutterbri23

customer_reviews.title: Good product for removing loose hairs from cats/dogs
customer_reviews.text: This product helps to remove the loose hair from my cat pretty well, even though some hairs will fly away because the hair will not attach to the glove. My cat sometimes likes it, but sometimes not; however, the glove gives protection when my cat tries to scratch or bite. Also, another use of the glove is to remove the hairs from the cat tree, and doing that also helps to remove the hair from the glove (which, if you do manually, it's a little tricky).
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra

customer_reviews.title: Solved: cat who hates being brushed
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my cat who hates being brushed. I am now able to pet him with the glove on and drastically reduce his shedding. The glove works great for grabbing his excess hair and it is easy to remove the hair from the glove. I wish I had found this inexpensive and trauma free solution years ago.
customer_reviews.author: LoveUniqueItems

customer_reviews.title: Pets love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our new greyhound, Flash, we adopted just 28 hours ago from a rescue center that receives the dogs from Tijuana, Mexico. He's 2 yrs old and has only been out of a crate for a few week. The Pet Paw is his heaven! It immediately calmed him and he responded affectionately. When he sees it he puts his paws on us. The fur is easily removed. With time, we're confident his dandruff and shedding will improve. Thanks from pampered Flash!
customer_reviews.author: c diva

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have a rescued cat and she doesn’t trust the brushes, we bought a very expensive one first and it was a total fiasco. This glove though, was love at first swipe hehe She loves it and even leans towards it asking for more. Couldn’t be happier. Oh, and very important...get the job done really well and super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Analisa B.

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats, two short hair and one long hair. They seem to enjoy being groomed with this glove, and it really does remove lots of fur. It is easy to strip off the clump of fur from the pronged side of the glove. The glove is larger than my hand and so it is a little awkward to use, but it does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Hollyellen

customer_reviews.title: Works much better than wire brushes on cats
customer_reviews.text: Works much better than wire brushes on cats! One of my two cats isn't too fond of brushes, but he's very content being groomed with this glove. One minute with it collects more loose hair than the two brushes I have get with much more time. Faster, more effective, and more acceptable to the animals... this glove is definitely a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Chris LTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Good construction
customer_reviews.text: Well, I really like the concept and it would be great if my cats weren't so afraid of it. They see a big glove coming toward them that starts rubbing them and they kind of freak, but my cats don't like to be groomed that's why I thought this would help. It might be perfect for some cats and some cats may love it. I guess it all depends on the cats.
customer_reviews.author: Evie

customer_reviews.title: 3 cats, 2 dogs
customer_reviews.text: On the plus side, the pets enjoy them; on the minus side, they don't get much fur. I have one short hair cat and two long hair, one medium hair dog and a lab. They don't seem to work well on any of them. The lab loves being rubbed down by them and it gets some fur, just not enough to be worth it other than for her enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: KMcDonald

customer_reviews.title: Didn't expect it to work as well as it does
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it very briefly and I really didn't expect it to work with the bristles being so far apart, but HOLY CROW did that opinion get proved wrong. I am highly allergic to my medium haired cat, and while he'll need to get used to it, it really pulled up the loose hair and was easy to clean off. Love this, so glad I finally found something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Storm

customer_reviews.title: The dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: My dog has to have a medicated bath every week and needs to be really scrubbed down. These gloves have helped tremendously, but are a bit large for my average sized lady's hands, and tend to slip around a bit. That is the only problem I have with them. They are certainly worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Dani Muckleroy

customer_reviews.title: Grooming and petting at the same time!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs hate to be brushed and it is a struggle to get them to stay still. These gloves cured the problem! They feel like they are getting stroked with love and actually they are getting "brushed" all at the same time. They hate when I stop! The prongs are strong and long enough to get to the skin, but not do hard that it hurts them. Best thing I've bought in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Jean

customer_reviews.title: My pets love this! Ones that didn't previously like being brushed ...
customer_reviews.text: My pets love this! Ones that didn't previously like being brushed now love being brushed. I cannot believe how much hair it extracts, either. It's like another pet coming out of these pets with the amount of hair. I would definitely get another one and highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Author Angie Martin

customer_reviews.title: Depends on the cat...
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good glove. My one cat (shorthaired tabby) loves it, and will follow you around begging if you're wearing the other glove. My other cat, an extra fluffy Ragdoll, much prefers being brushed with an actual brush. Different strokes, I guess - but the glove works very well for the tabby.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: This glove is the cat's meow!
customer_reviews.text: My cats think it's the rough tongue of a big mama tiger licking their fur clean. Each cat purred loudly, and they both moved themselves in various positions so that the glove would get their entire body surface areas... haha!!! It was fun watching them enjoy their experiences. I will be buying another glove for my daughter to use on her little cutie kitty >^.^<
customer_reviews.author: L. Ward

customer_reviews.title: It is good
customer_reviews.text: I would love to write a review but when I tried using it on my short hair cat he didn’t like it but he is very difficult to deal with at times and he is the reason I got it. I also have a long hair cat and he likes it. I wasn’t going to write one but knew if I didn’t Amazon would keep asking.
customer_reviews.author: Charon Elizabeth Kading

customer_reviews.title: Great for lovey lap cats!
customer_reviews.text: My short haired cat absolutely loves this glove for grooming. It's his favorite time of the day when he sees this come out. My long haired cat, however, is not a fan. She's also a diva and not into being petted for extended amounts of time. But its worth it alone for all the hair I get off my short hair. It is easy to use and the fur comes off easy, as well as long as you allow a good portion to build up, then it peels right off. If your cat is more of a lovey, lap cat who loves to be rubbed, get this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog Heaven!
customer_reviews.text: Our 11-year-old lab loves being massaged. It has kept her limber, active and in great shape. She absolutely loves this glove! As soon as I get it, she looks for a spot to lie down and ready for a rub down! Personally I like it because I can collect her hair so easily as it adheres just as advertised. I highly recommend it for your pet's well-being and enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Satterlee

customer_reviews.title: Cats seem to like these!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gloves on all 3 of my 6 month old kittens and they seem pretty tolerant of them. They purr quite a bit when using them and don’t wiggle away or fuss too much at being brushed with the gloves. These seem well made and look like they will last for a long time. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: quiltgirl

customer_reviews.title: Hairpocalypse now
customer_reviews.text: If you have a heavy coat dog, like a lab, get these gloves and start stockpiling hair like nobody’s business. Doggos seem to not hate these as much as those wire brush thingers, too. I am even tempted to bring them to the dog park to de-fur strangers’ dogs as they come by for pets and sniffs.
customer_reviews.author: S. Buch

customer_reviews.title: my best friend is a dog groomer and the tools she ...
customer_reviews.text: Gimmicky dog grooming supplies are rampant in my house. Weird, my best friend is a dog groomer and the tools she uses work better than anything you can get an average store. Doesn't really remove hair better than anything I've ever used. A shedding blade works better. A zoom groom works better. I will say my dog has longer fur on her tail and legs so if you have a short haired dog then it might work better?
customer_reviews.author: jazzypantz

customer_reviews.title: Picky Senior finds true love!
customer_reviews.text: My seniors dog does not like being groomed. Dislikes the furminator, the furry comb style groomer, and most all the rest I’ve tried. She loves this one, becomes playful and races around a bit when we’re done. And it really does take off a lot of hair. Just pull to remove what’s on the glove.
customer_reviews.author: onislandtime

customer_reviews.title: OK but not the best
customer_reviews.text: I had higher expectations for this. It doesn’t remove hair that much hair and the hair isn’t very easy to remove from the glove either. I have an Aussie and the furminator (or similar type brush) works way better. This glove works better to pet / massage dog.
customer_reviews.author: Koala_FL

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves being pet with this glove
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I have a short hair mastiff so I can’t get as much hair on it as I’d like to but it’s because she’s short haired. Not really sure how to clean it other than pulling hair off which doesn’t get all the hair off. I like the ease of use and my dog likes being pet with it.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen George

customer_reviews.title: AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: just arrived today. Used it on my shepard and she loves it. She even layed down to let me get her belly and chest area. This would not happen with the other products i have. This seems to be the best hair remover ever. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Paquette

customer_reviews.title: Milo ❤️S it
customer_reviews.text: Our cat, Milo loves to be “pet” with this glove. And the hair mostly sticks to the palm and you can easily lift it off. However, the glove has started coming apart at the seams and we’ve only had it a few weeks. I can repair the glove at home and I hope it doesn’t continue falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.E

customer_reviews.title: This glove will bring lots of pleasure to your cats or dogs & they will look beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Well as most people who own cats know, no matter how much your cat loves something they don’t like to show you at first. Well both our cats love the feel of the glove when we pet them. The glove is very well made & the tips of rubber on the grooming side are larger then most grooming gloves. It has a Velcro band built in so it doesn’t fall off your hand. Your cats or dogs will love this! Howard M, Popo & Hemi (those are our cats
customer_reviews.author: Howard Millstein

customer_reviews.title: 100% satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love it! I’m shocked at how well this glove works. I have a short haired cat and I’ve taken more hair off of her using this twice than I probably have in months of regular brushing. I thought the shortness of the bumps and big space between them would make it work subpar, but figured that’s why it was so cheap- nope, works perfectly. So glad I didn’t send more money, I have zero complaints. My cat also really likes it a lot- much easier to get all over since she thinks she’s just being pet. It doesn’t trap 100% of the hair, like some still flies away, but I think that’s to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs that don't love to be brushed
customer_reviews.text: The Kong ZoomGroom is great but if you dog isn't one that loves to be brushed, then these help it feel more loving and personal. Using two gloves make it more difficult to remove the hair while 'brushing' but I really don't care. I brush outdoors. If I was indoors maybe only one glove would be a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: 60Something

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE BEST PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh!!! Cannot say enough about this product!! It is perfectly flexible, not stiff or uncomfortable. My kitty is ecstatic-absolutely loves it, as does his human! Who knew he had THIS much extra fur??? Oh my, does this work! Easy to clean, the hair just peels right off. Would recommend to anyone/everyone for their pets.
customer_reviews.author: Sea

customer_reviews.title: Husky worthy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a beautiful shedder(Husky) and a Cocker Spaniel-Poodle. These have been awesome & work beautifully on her. Since you actually get 2 gloves, the lady & I can do it together. Also work great when giving them a bath between grooms. It helps keep them calm with the bristles massaging them, while helping spread the shampoo. I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: Work amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Have three cats so I decided to try the gloves out. Boy do they work great, get off way more hair than out normal brush we used. I can get a golf ball size hair ball just from brushing one cat with these for a minute! My cats are all short hair cats as well. I’d highly recommend these over a normal brush
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S.

customer_reviews.title: Stress free brushing for anxious dog!
customer_reviews.text: Our lab mix rescue hates being brushed, but he loves to be pet. This is a wonderful way to brush him and get that hair off before he gets on the bed! Best to do it outside as the hair will be on the gloves and the ground. I just smacked the gloves together to remove most of the hair from the gloves. I could easily pick the few remaining hairs off or rinse them off the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Joyfuljr

customer_reviews.title: Cat + Grooming Gloves = Love
customer_reviews.text: As far as my cat is concerned, these are the best $20.00 I've ever spent. She loves to be "gloved." Brush her with the gloves, and she purrs, she can't get enough. It leaves her fur soft, cuts down on hairballs, and generally makes for a happier cat. I saw the videos of pets loving the grooming gloves, but I wasn't sure my cat would be the same-- she tends to be picky-picky. But, she does love it! Glad we decided to make the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SunflowerGirl

customer_reviews.title: I have a beautiful Himalayan kitten who definitely needs this in her life
customer_reviews.text: Omg! I have a beautiful Himalayan kitten who is six months old and she loves to be brushed and groomed, thank goodness! I absolutely love this love as it truly does grab the for and if that wasn’t easy enough when you’re done and literally peels right off the glove when you’re done. I meant to take photos the first time I used it, I will have to submit a picture of that next time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: 🍀🍀 GREEN IRISH EYES 🍀🍀

customer_reviews.title: Great for my cat, and for my house.
customer_reviews.text: I have a short hair cat and I can't believe how much loose fur this takes off of her. Greatly reduces the amount of hair left around the house, which is usually a lot. Also, she loves the massage she gets with it. Easy to clean and easy to use. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Definitely glad I got these!
customer_reviews.text: My cat hated being brushed. When I started "brushing" her with these gloves, she was a little freaked out and would run away. However, she always came back and wanted more. She seems to really like them. The hair was pretty easy to get off the gloves, but I did make sure there was a good amount before peeling it off. I'm very pleased, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tigergirl

customer_reviews.title: Great Problem Solver
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a lifesaver for removing hair from my cat. She sheds tremendously during the early months of summer and this product has contained that hair from growing all over the house. She loves the attention and the feeling of the glove
customer_reviews.author: robert york

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, neither one of my cats like it. They react like - WTH? However, I have other uses for it. I use it to remove hair from shag rugs my vacuum won't work on and from furniture. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Clawson

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat really enjoys being brushed with this! It's so much easier to keep him still versus a regular brush. The only caveat: His fur does not peel off as easily as the company shows. I read somewhere that you're supposed to let the glove get really full first...maybe that's why it's not working as easily for me. Regardless, it still comes off fairly quickly, and it's worth it for how much fur it removes from my cat and how happy it makes him!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five star product.
customer_reviews.text: You can't see it in the video, but it picks up fur very well. The cats love it! It's very gentle, but gets the job done. Very pleasant way to groom while we're cuddling! I have no complaints whatsoever. Five star product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Walker

customer_reviews.title: Get that fur off
customer_reviews.text: My cat is very particular. He doesn’t like most things. He loves the grooming glove though. He was surprised at first but after the second brush he looked so stoked. So we just sat and brushed for a few minutes and by the time we were done we had a second cat’s worth of fur. I showed him the big ball of fur and he screamed. I think it was unsettling knowing how much extra fur he’d been carrying around for this long. Moving forward I don’t think I will reveal the fur ball to him. Anyways it’s great. What are you waiting for? Get that fur off.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford A. Wilde

customer_reviews.title: Must have for pet grooming
customer_reviews.text: This glove is great! For both washing and brushing, this is an excellent tool, so much easier than a brush. My son-in-law "borrowed" it to try on very large white dog that drips hair as it walks through the room. Worked great and with regular use, no more dripping hair. I ended up buying another for him so I could keep mine. Highly recommend for easy grooming.
customer_reviews.author: newflowers

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this and it does remove hair from our cat. But she doesn’t really like it and doesn’t hold still so I can’t get much off at once. I wish it would grab more at one time for that reason. Also tried it on our dog and it doesn’t really work on her. She has coarser hair. I think you need softer hair for this to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Heather E.

customer_reviews.title: My cats and I love these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are fantastic! I used them immediately and removed 6 mitts full of hair from my two cats. They love being pet with the gloves and run over to be pet when they see them. Their fur is softer and there is less hair on the floor and the couch (yay!!) after petting with the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: books

customer_reviews.title: Really love how easy it is to brush the kitties now
customer_reviews.text: Really love how easy it is to brush the kitties now. It is a “one size fits all” glove so it fits my hand somewhat loosely but it would work for a wide range of hand sizes. I sewed the top of the fingers to make them a little more slender.
customer_reviews.author: Demaris Braswell

customer_reviews.title: Worked much better than I had expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked much better than I had expected! Is really great as it does pull the loose hair off your pet while you are massaging them. My dogs had no objection and I was amazed at how easy it was to get the hair off the glove. I wish I had known about this long ago!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: I love the Pet Grooming Glove
customer_reviews.text: I love the Pet Grooming Glove ! My cats love it more!!! It works better than any brush - no chance of hitting your pet. The glove is flexible. It truly collects all the hair on your cat - extremely easy to clean the hair off the glove. Totally recommend to try!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly constructed.
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job of removing cat fur, but then it's really hard to get the fur off the glove, and the seams started falling apart the first time I used them. The wrist is completely detached from the left glove now. Poor quality. Should have ordered a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: A. Leahy

product_meta.title: Pet Grooming Glove - Enhanced Five Finger Design - for Cats, Dogs and Horses - Long & Short Fur - Gentle De-Shedding Brush - Your Pet Will Love It
product_meta.description:
Pattern Name:Right

LOVE YOUR PET BUT NOT THE SHEDDING?

We have great solution to your hairy problems!

Try our “Pat Your Pet” Grooming Glove and completelyforget about sheddinglike an awful nightmare. Get rid of hairballs before they appear once and for all!

Our high-quality Grooming Glove was designed to beextremely gentle with your petbringing only satisfaction and pleasure. Grooming has never felt so good! From now this will be a long-awaited reward for your little furry friend associated with an extra attention and closeness.

You will achievegreat grooming results while just petting and stroking your pet. No more stressful chasing trying to comb out your pet.

HERE ARE SOME COOL FEATURES OF THE GLOVE: 

 * ENHANCED FIVE FINGER DESIGN – Glove gently imitates stroking by your hand. Let your furbaby think he is getting petted instead of groomed. 
 * 
 * USE IT WET OR DRY– It’s great for bathing your pet, washing with waterless shampoo or cleaning with detangling spray.
 * 
 * PETS LOVE GLOVE - Scrubbing nubs provide soft skin massage, your pet will ask for more!
 * 
 * REDUCE SHEDDING - Regular brushing removes loose undercoat, eliminates those nasty mats and knots.
 * 
 * ADJUSTABLE WRIST STRAP – gently secures glove on any hand.
 * 
 * EASY TO CLEAN - When grooming session is finished – simply peel the hair off and throw it away.
 * 
 * PERFECT CARE FOR ALL FURRY FRIENDS - Skittish cats or playful dogs, graceful horses or fluffy rabbits and even goats!
 * 

So, what are you waiting for? As you see, we have thought everything out, our grooming glove is just what you need! One Glove - clean house, healthy pet and happy you.

Press "ADD TO CART" nowand when you do, consider getting two... one for you and one for a friend as a gift.

Have only the best moments with your furry friend and enjoy your clean house!
feature_bullets: Forget about shedding - Our Glove easily removes loose pet hair and tangles so no fur goes flying
Enhanced five finger design - Allows you to groom hard-to-reach places like face or tail
Pets love glove - Rubber tips provide gentle relaxing massage. Petting is better than pet chasing
For short, medium & long coat - Extra gentle for daily grooming. Perfect for sensitive & young pets
Make your grooming routine easy - With this glove you'll keep your pet attractive and home hair-free

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
